central_thesis: The document explores the integration of Setian philosophy, particularly the concepts of Xeper, Remanifestation, and Runa, with practical self-development, an understanding of biological and cultural influences, and operative magical mechanics. It emphasizes individual conscious evolution, personal responsibility, and the pragmatic application of both Lesser and Greater Black Magic for self-deification and interaction with the objective universe.

structure_content.summary: This article posits initiation as a self-ordering process where the human organism, as an open system, interacts with both matter and spirit. It stresses the importance of understanding material processes and biological vulnerabilities (like diseases and epidemics) to achieve independence from the natural order, framing this as a critical aspect of an Initiate's journey towards proto-deity. It critically analyzes public perceptions of 'new' diseases versus the reemergence of infectious pathogens due to biological and cultural conditions.

structure_content.chapter_title: [4] Words of an Æon Through the Eyes of the Newly-Awakened
structure_content.summary: This article defines core Setian concepts: Xeper as 'becoming' or the psyche's movement towards deification through self-growth; Remanifestation as the crystallization and integration of knowledge and experiences during Xeper, enabling continuous advancement; and Runa as the universal concept of reaching out for the unknown, providing the impetus for Xeper and Remanifestation. These are presented as universal concepts within the human psyche, crystallized by the 'Magus to Utter the Word'.

This article outlines a two-phase ritual system for achieving personal goals and transforming the self/environment. Phase One involves daily planning, visualizing streams of 'darkness' (energy from other magicians), performing tasks, and an affirmation (Xepera Xeper Xeperu). Phase Two escalates this by increasing goals and visualizing seven streams of darkness, including one from a 'binder of deeds done', with the formula written in hieroglyphs. It also suggests imaginative astral journeys to 'Uncle Setnakt's Bar And Grill' for ally-spirits.

This section provides a detailed magical interpretation of the four subjective parts of the Egyptian soul-body complex: Ba (momentum/regenerative power), Ka (images of what-is-to-be/life-force created by 'imaging principle'), Akh (effective spirit/luminous ascended being), and Sekhem (power/god-in-heart residing in an 'ib' constructed as a temple). It also touches on Khat (physical body), Ren (name), Khabit (shadow), and Ib (heart), emphasizing their roles in Setian magic and self-development, particularly the Elect's unique access to Sekhem.

structure_content.chapter_title: [13] Ninjutsu: Warrior Way of the Left-Hand Path
structure_content.summary: This article analyzes Ninjutsu as a Left-Hand Path system, contrasting it with Right-Hand Path martial arts. It details the ninja's magical system based on the five elements (getsu, ka, sui, fu, ku) and mikkyo (occult doctrines) categorized as LBM (invisibility, water walking, shape-shifting) and GBM (consciousness-enhancing meditation, kuji-in, spiritual development towards divinity). It highlights Ninjutsu's operative, pragmatic nature, and its alignment with Setian principles.

This article explores the concept of the Magical Link as a force facilitating interaction between the subjective universe (SU) and objective universe (OU). It proposes HarWer (humanity, specifically the physical body) as the embodiment of this 'middle man' principle, acting as a buffer between Set-consciousness and cosmic inertia. The text questions how to construct a post-mortem HarWer to allow the psyche to survive physical death and discusses how Black Magicians, through GBM, might imbue the OU with aspects of their own consciousness to create a 'hybrid' OU/HarWer.

This article defines 'Indulgence' as the conscious, willed art of evoking feelings, thoughts, or sensations for magical work, distinguishing it from unconscious compulsion. It describes internal indulgence for self-understanding and external indulgence for evoking states useful in Lesser Black Magic (LBM). The concept is linked to Ipsissimus Lewis's 'divine' orientation, with Xeper serving to prevent excessive indulgence from becoming a pitfall.

key_concepts.definition: The Setian concept of 'Becoming,' representing the movement of the psyche towards deification through self-growth and conscious evolution.
The crystallization and integration of knowledge and experiences gathered during the process of Xeper, allowing the psyche to move forward in a continual, never-ending cycle of self-improvement.
The crystallization of the universal concept of reaching out for the unknown; the mystery that provides the reason and drive for Xeper and Remanifestation.

A part of the Egyptian soul-body complex, understood as 'momentum,' 'fame,' 'esteem,' 'might,' or 'regenerative power' — the accumulated power built up in one's life that enables regeneration and manifests in the characteristics of one's Xeperu.

A part of the Egyptian soul-body complex, representing 'images of what-is-to-be' or the 'life-force of things in motion.' It serves as 'nourishment' for unfolding events and is created through the 'imaging principle' (heka/magic), often linked to creative visualization.

The 'effective spirit' or 'luminous' ascended being in Egyptian cosmology. It possesses the power to move across Earth, the Tuat, and the sky, and for some, the ability to summon one's future, immortalized self.

A part of the Egyptian soul-body complex translated as 'power' or 'god.' It is an impersonal power that may reside in an intellect (ib) constructed as a 'temple,' empowering purposes aligned with Set's will.

A force or principle that facilitates interaction and transformation between the subjective universe (SU) and the objective universe (OU). It operates both ways, allowing the Black Magician to apply will to the SU to cause changes in the OU.

An embodiment of the 'middle man' principle, representing humanity itself. It acts as a buffer between Set-consciousness and cosmic inertia, facilitating interaction with the OU while preventing consumption by it, and potentially enabling the psyche's survival post-mortem.

Set's own essence, instilled in another race (humanity), allowing for isolate intelligence and self-awareness. It is the core of Setian initiation and the means by which one's own HarWer is constructed.

The conscious and willed art of evoking specific feelings, thoughts, or sensations within oneself, used for self-understanding (internal) or to assist in magical work (external), distinct from unconscious compulsion.
Magical practice focused on manipulating one's subjective universe to create a corresponding, desired change in the objective universe, aiming to cause the OU to reflect one's idealized SU.
Practical, operative magic focused on specific tasks or achieving tangible effects in the external world, such as invisibility or psychological warfare, as discussed in the context of Ninjutsu.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a system of self-initiation and magical practice centered on the Setian principle of Xeper (Becoming). It integrates introspection, goal-setting, energy manipulation, and a deep understanding of the self's components (Ba, Ka, Akh, Sekhem) and its interaction with the objective universe via the Magical Link and HarWer. The system emphasizes conscious will, personal responsibility, and a pragmatic, operative approach to both internal and external transformation, aimed at achieving individual ascendancy and an 'idealized SU' reflected in the OU.
tools: The 'imaging principle' (heka/magic) for creating 'ka' (mental images of what-is-to-be).
A binder of deeds (for tracking progress in the Xepera Xeper Xeperu ritual).
Understanding and manipulation of the Egyptian soul-body components (Ba, Ka, Akh, Sekhem).
Knowledge of the Magical Link and HarWer for interacting with the subjective and objective universes.
Self-analysis and introspection for identifying and overcoming personal 'addictions' or hindrances to Xeper.
Physical actions and focused attention as part of daily magical work.
rituals: The 'Xepera Xeper Xeperu' ritual (two phases): involves daily goal-setting, visualizing dark energy streams (from cardinal points, Tuat, Constellation of the Thigh, binder of deeds), and uttering specific affirmations to achieve objectives and create energy.
Indulgence practices: conscious evocation of specific feelings, thoughts, or sensations by will to prepare the mind for Greater Black Magic (GBM).

Ninjutsu magical techniques: elemental practices (earth, fire, water, wind, void), kuji-in hand symbols, and consciousness-enhancing meditation for LBM operations like invisibility or psychological warfare.

Construction of a post-mortem HarWer: an implicit long-term goal for Black Magicians to ensure the psyche's survival beyond biological death by imbuing aspects of one's consciousness into the Objective Universe (OU) through GBM.

relevant_quotes.text: Initiation is a self-ordering change process at the intersection of life and intelligence. Here the human organism is an open system to the experiences of both matter and spirit. As an evolving organism, the human being eats, shits, reproduces, and interacts with other life forms. As a developing proto-deity, the human becoming ascends to his own tune. It is important to understand that these processes are not exclusive of one another. Instead they form a complimentary dialectic in the initiatory process.
Xeper is 'becoming' according to Ipsissimus Aquino. It represents the movement of the psyche towards deification through self-growth.

Remanifest is the idea of the crystallization of knowledge and experiences gathered during the process of Xeper. This crystallization, i.e. Remanifestation, is the process whereby the psyche integrates what has been learned and thus moves forward to Xeper again. This will then lead once more to the process of Remanifestation - a continual cycle that never ends as long as one wills to Xeper.

Runa is the crystallization of the universal concept of reaching out for the unknown. It gives us a reason to take the path of Xeper and Remanifestation. Runa is what is not known: the mystery which leads us to continually push aside the veil and look beyond what we already know.

To mark the achievement of all four tasks, write 'Xepera Xeper Xeperu' at the base of the page. Say the formula in your native tongue: 'I Have Come Into Being and by Coming Into Being created the way of Coming Into Being for those things that have Come Into Being.'

The Black Magician is one who has discovered not only the existence of the Magical Link, but one of its darkest secrets as well: that it works both ways and can also be used toward the exaltation, rather than sublimation of the microcosm, if one so dares.

Magically speaking, we must conduct initiation in the 'Hot Zone' through integrated mind-body development, creativity, flexibility, lots of feedforward, and serendipitous decisionmaking. It's all a game of chance. But as Louis Pasteur once said, 'Chance favors the prepared mind.'

The Temple of Set's sole concern in matters of romance/sex between Initiates is that 'no senior Initiate use his/her degree or office to influence such a relationship in any way, either positively or negatively'.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles from 'The Scroll of Set' serves as a crucial resource for understanding contemporary Setian philosophy and magical practice in the mid-1990s. It synthesizes diverse esoteric traditions, including Egyptian cosmology and Eastern martial arts occultism (Ninjutsu), with a pragmatic, often scientific perspective on human biology and societal dynamics. The work stands out for its emphasis on active, conscious self-deification (Xeper), personal responsibility, and the operative application of magic (both LBM and GBM) to effect both internal and external transformation. It uniquely grounds esoteric concepts in a critical awareness of real-world biological and cultural 'Hot Zones', offering a holistic approach to initiation that is both intellectually rigorous and practically oriented.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Initiates and practitioners of the Temple of Set seeking to deepen their understanding and practice of Setian philosophy. It is also highly relevant for advanced occultists interested in Left-Hand Path traditions, particularly those with an inclination towards pragmatic magic, self-development, and a critical, non-dogmatic approach to esoteric studies. Additionally, academic researchers specializing in Western Esotericism, modern occultism, and the sociology of new religious movements would find value in its detailed explanations of Setian concepts and practices, as well as its unique contextualization of magical work within broader scientific and cultural discussions.
